GRPO Pipeline API¶

The GRPO evaluation pipeline is composed of several small modules that coordinate how prompts, paths, and stage selection are resolved before being handed off to the stage runners. The entries below are indexed for quick reference when integrating the pipeline in experiments or scripting end-to-end runs.

Core Orchestration¶

CLI entry point for evaluating and reporting on GRPO baselines.

This module focuses on orchestration and re-exports, delegating most implementation details to small submodules under grpo:

  • grpo.pipeline_cli — CLI parsing

  • grpo.pipeline_common — logging and summary helpers

  • grpo.pipeline_setup — context and prompt resolution

  • grpo.pipeline_loaders — cache loaders and rebuilders

  • grpo.pipeline_runner — evaluation and reporting runners

The public surface and internal helpers remain accessible via grpo.pipeline to preserve backwards compatibility and tests.

class grpo.pipeline.FilterSelection(issues, studies)[source]¶

Bases: object

Lower-cased filters applied before evaluation.

Variables:

  • issues (tuple[str, ...]) – Issue labels required for inclusion.

  • studies (tuple[str, ...]) – Participant-study identifiers required for inclusion.

Parameters:

  • issues (tuple[str, ...])

  • studies (tuple[str, ...])

allows(example)[source]¶

Return True when the example passes the configured filters.

Parameters:

example (grpo.dataset.PreparedExample) – Prepared example describing a single evaluation row.

Returns:

True if the example should be evaluated; otherwise False.

Return type:

bool

classmethod from_raw(*, issues, studies)[source]¶

Build a FilterSelection from raw CLI tokens.

Parameters:

  • issues (Sequence[str] | None) – Raw issue filter tokens provided by the CLI.

  • studies (Sequence[str] | None) – Raw participant-study filter tokens.

Returns:

Normalised FilterSelection instance.

Return type:

FilterSelection

issues: tuple[str, ...]¶
metrics_filters()[source]¶

Return the EvaluationFilters payload for metrics.

Returns:

Filters compatible with common.evaluation.slate_eval.

Return type:

slate_eval.EvaluationFilters

studies: tuple[str, ...]¶
class grpo.pipeline.NextVideoDatasetSpec(name, split, cache_dir)[source]¶

Bases: object

Dataset selection applied when loading evaluation rows.

Variables:

  • name (str) – Local path or Hugging Face dataset identifier.

  • split (str) – Dataset split name used for evaluation.

  • cache_dir (str | None) – Optional datasets cache directory.

Parameters:

  • name (str)

  • split (str)

  • cache_dir (str | None)

cache_dir: str | None¶
name: str¶
split: str¶
class grpo.pipeline.NextVideoEvaluationLimits(max_examples, flush_every=0)[source]¶

Bases: object

Caps and cadence controlling the evaluation runtime.

Variables:

  • max_examples (int) – Maximum number of examples to process; 0 disables the cap.

  • flush_every (int) – Periodic flush interval in examples; 0 disables flushing.

Parameters:

  • max_examples (int)

  • flush_every (int)

example_cap()[source]¶

Return the maximum number of examples to evaluate, if any.

Returns:

Positive integer limit or None when unrestricted.

Return type:

int | None

flush_every: int = 0¶
max_examples: int¶
class grpo.pipeline.NextVideoEvaluationResult(run_dir, metrics_path, predictions_path, qa_log_path, metrics)[source]¶

Bases: object

Aggregated artefacts produced by the evaluation runner.

Variables:

  • run_dir (Path) – Evaluation run directory.

  • metrics_path (Path) – Path to the metrics JSON file.

  • predictions_path (Path) – Path to the predictions JSONL.

  • qa_log_path (Path) – Path to the rendered QA log.

  • metrics (Mapping[str, object]) – In-memory metrics payload.

Parameters:

  • run_dir (pathlib.Path)

  • metrics_path (pathlib.Path)

  • predictions_path (pathlib.Path)

  • qa_log_path (pathlib.Path)

  • metrics (Mapping[str, object])

metrics: Mapping[str, object]¶
metrics_path: pathlib.Path¶
predictions_path: pathlib.Path¶
qa_log_path: pathlib.Path¶
run_dir: pathlib.Path¶
class grpo.pipeline.NextVideoEvaluationSettings(model_label, dataset, prompts, limits, overwrite, generation, filters)[source]¶

Bases: object

Configuration bundle controlling next-video evaluation.

Variables:

  • model_label (str) – Human-readable label associated with the model.

  • dataset (NextVideoDatasetSpec) – Dataset selection parameters.

  • prompts (NextVideoPromptSettings) – Prompt configuration for examples.

  • limits (NextVideoEvaluationLimits) – Runtime evaluation limits.

  • overwrite (bool) – Whether to overwrite existing artefacts.

  • generation (GenerationSettings) – Generation hyperparameters.

  • filters (FilterSelection) – Pre-evaluation filter configuration.

Parameters:

  • model_label (str)

  • dataset (NextVideoDatasetSpec)

  • prompts (NextVideoPromptSettings)

  • limits (NextVideoEvaluationLimits)

  • overwrite (bool)

  • generation (GenerationSettings)

  • filters (FilterSelection)

dataset: NextVideoDatasetSpec¶
filters: FilterSelection¶
generation: GenerationSettings¶
limits: NextVideoEvaluationLimits¶
model_label: str¶
overwrite: bool¶
prompts: NextVideoPromptSettings¶
class grpo.pipeline.NextVideoPromptSettings(system_prompt, solution_key, max_history)[source]¶

Bases: object

Prompt parameters used when preparing evaluation examples.

Variables:

  • system_prompt (str) – Base system prompt for the model.

  • solution_key (str | None) – Dataset column containing the correct id.

  • max_history (int) – Maximum number of history turns to include.

Parameters:

  • system_prompt (str)

  • solution_key (str | None)

  • max_history (int)

max_history: int¶
solution_key: str | None¶
system_prompt: str¶

Parameters:

log_level (str | int)

grpo.pipeline.run_next_video_evaluation(*, tokenizer, model, settings, config_label, out_dir)[source]¶

Execute next-video evaluation for the provided GRPO checkpoint.

Parameters:

  • tokenizer (TokenizerLike) – Tokenizer configured for the GRPO checkpoint.

  • model (ModelLike) – Loaded causal language model under evaluation.

  • settings (NextVideoEvaluationSettings) – Evaluation configuration bundle.

  • config_label (str) – Label identifying the current configuration run.

  • out_dir (Path) – Base directory receiving evaluation outputs.

Returns:

Next-video evaluation artefacts produced during execution.

Return type:

NextVideoEvaluationResult

grpo.pipeline.run_opinion_evaluation(*, context, settings, out_dir)[source]¶

Evaluate opinion regression across configured studies.

Parameters:

  • context (OpinionInferenceContext)

  • settings (OpinionEvaluationSettings)

  • out_dir (Path)

Return type:

OpinionEvaluationResult

CLI argument parsing for grpo.pipeline.

Isolated to keep the main entrypoint small and to speed up import time for modules that only need types or helpers.

Setup & Context¶

Setup utilities for grpo.pipeline.

Contains helpers to build the runtime context, resolve prompt text, and summarize stage selections derived from CLI arguments.
